**By zeroxjf** | The prodigal son of TypeCentury

A system-wide typing indicator for iMessage that shows a sleek banner just below the notch or Dynamic Island whenever someone is typing to you.

**Tap** the banner to jump straight into the conversation, or **swipe** to dismiss. Configurable via Settings with a built-in test button.

- System-wide typing indicator banner below the status bar
- Dynamic Island–aware positioning
- Tap banner to open the conversation
- Swipe left or right to dismiss
- Dark mode and light mode support
- Multi-person typing detection (“Several people are typing…”)
- Test button in Settings to preview the banner
- Enable/disable toggle with automatic respring

TypeMillennium hooks into the Messages app to detect typing indicators from ChatKit. When someone starts typing, it writes the contact info to a shared file and posts a Darwin notification to SpringBoard, which displays a compact pill-shaped banner. The banner auto-dismisses after 3 seconds if the typing state goes stale.

- Fixed touch unresponsiveness caused by full-screen overlay window
- Banner window now sized exactly to the pill — no more touch blocking

- iOS 17.0 support (rootless / NathanLR)
- Dynamic Island–aware banner positioning
- Test button in Settings to preview the banner
- Improved UI with dark/light mode support

- Initial release
- System-wide iMessage typing indicator with banner UI
